context: The document provides information about the Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, including details about the program, career opportunities, and degree requirements. The given chunk describes the Aerospace Engineering program and its objectives.
chunk_text: Campus Worldwide Campus Embry-Riddle Online Asia Campus Degrees & Programs Admissions Research Partnerships About Us Leadership Strategic Plan Search Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering The Aerospace Engineering program equips students to enter the industry prepared to tackle challenges regarding aircraft design and space exploration. About the Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering The Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering (BSAE) program at Embry-Riddle equips students

context: The Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering (BSAE) program at Embry-Riddle is described, highlighting its focus on equipping students with skills to solve complex challenges in aircraft design, propulsion, and space exploration, as well as the department's state-of-the-art resources and its position as the largest of its kind in the country.
chunk_text: (BSAE) program at Embry-Riddle equips students with skills to solve even the most complex challenges in aircraft design, propulsion, systems for spacecraft and space exploration. The Aerospace Engineering department is the largest of its kind in the country, with students benefiting from state-of-the-art resources — the same tools in use by aerospace engineering professionals around the globe. No other Aerospace Engineering program in the United States attracts more students, gaining hands-on

context: The chunk describes the opportunities available to students in the Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, including hands-on experience, projects, competitions, research, and internships, as well as the focus on understanding mission-oriented vehicles, spacecraft systems, and developing competency with industry-standard tools.
chunk_text: States attracts more students, gaining hands-on experience from the start, with opportunities to participate in various projects, competitions, research and internships. In aerospace engineering you will have the opportunity to: Understand the engineering of mission-oriented vehicles through space vehicle and aircraft design, structures and propulsion Utilize practical engineering to balance the theoretical analysis required to understand spacecraft systems Develop competency with the same

context: The chunk describes the career opportunities and employment prospects for graduates of the Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, highlighting the high job placement rate and the projected industry growth.
chunk_text: systems Develop competency with the same tools in use by aerospace engineering professionals Aerospace Engineering Career Opportunities Careers and Employers With an industry growth of 6% over the next decade, an estimated 3,800 job openings for aerospace engineers are projected each year, according to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) . Embry-Riddle’s Aerospace Engineering graduates enjoy an extremely high 94% placement rate in the year after graduation. Many students gateway into the

context: The chunk describes the career opportunities and average salaries for graduates of the Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University.
chunk_text: after graduation. Many students gateway into the industry through internships with aerospace and aeronautical companies like The Boeing Company, Lockheed Martin, NASA, Northrop Grumman and many more. Aerospace Engineering graduates are employed by the same companies in positions such as Aircraft Systems Engineers, Avionics Engineers, Aerospace Systems Analysts and Flight Test Engineers. context: The document provides information about the Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, including details about the program's offerings at the Daytona Beach, FL and Prescott, AZ campuses. The provided chunk discusses the average reported salary for Embry-Riddle graduates with this degree and provides details about the program's availability at the two campuses.
chunk_text: reported salary for Embry-Riddle graduates with a Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering is $77,000 annually as of 2023. context: The Daytona Beach, FL Campus of Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University offers a Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering program that includes combined and accelerated degree programs, as well as a highly ranked curriculum.
chunk_text: Campus offers combined and accelerated degree programs that allow well-qualified students the chance to begin graduate work in a master’s program while finishing their bachelor’s degree. First-year students must complete the College of Engineering’s Freshman Engineering Program before continuing with their Aerospace Engineering courses. The program is currently ranked No. 4 in the country by U.S. News and World Report , above some elite Aerospace Engineering programs and No. 1 in the state of

context: The Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle's Daytona Beach Campus is ranked No. 4 in the country and No. 1 in the state of Florida. The department strives for diversity, equity, and inclusion, with 23% female students and 24% underrepresented minorities in the B.S. program, which is higher than the national average. The Daytona Beach Campus offers four track options for the aerospace engineering degree, including Aeronautics.
chunk_text: Engineering programs and No. 1 in the state of Florida. The department strives for diversity, equity and inclusion of all students. Currently we have 23% female students and 24% underrepresented minorities in our B.S. program, which is about 7% and 9% (respectively) higher than the national average for Aerospace Engineering programs. Tracks/Specialties and/or Certificates The Daytona Beach Campus offers four track options for the aerospace engineering degree: Aeronautics: Focuses on

context: The document describes the Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering program at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University, which offers four track options for the degree: Aeronautics, Astronautics, Jet Propulsion, and Rocket Propulsion.
chunk_text: engineering degree: Aeronautics: Focuses on aerodynamics with wind tunnel experience, aircraft design and analysis and the stability, controllability and flight testing of aircraft. Astronautics: Focuses on orbital mechanics, spacecraft controls, rocket propulsion and structural analysis. Jet Propulsion: Focuses on air-breathing propulsion, including turbojets, turbofans and ramjet engines. Rocket Propulsion: Focuses on spacecraft propulsion associated with launch vehicles and space

chunk_text: formulate, and solve complex engineering problems by applying principles of engineering, science, and mathematics. Have an ability to communicate effectively with a range of audiences. Have an ability to recognize ethical and professional responsibilities in engineering

chunk_text: and professional responsibilities in engineering situations and make informed judgments, which must consider the impact of engineering solutions in global, economic, environmental, and societal contexts. chunk_text: Campus offers two track options for the aerospace engineering degree: Aeronautics: Focuses on aerodynamics with wind tunnel experience, aircraft design and analysis and the stability, controllability and flight testing of aircraft . Astronautics: Focuses on orbital mechanics, spacecraft controls, rocket propulsion and structural analysis . Degree Requirements The Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering program requires successful completion of a minimum of 129 credit hours. The program may be completed in eight semesters assuming appropriate background and full-time enrollment. A minimum cumulative grade point average of 2.00 is needed for all required AE, EGR, EP, ES,

context: This section outlines the general education and program requirements for the Bachelor of Science in Aerospace Engineering degree at Embry-Riddle Aeronautical University.
chunk_text: 2.00 is needed for all required AE, EGR, EP, ES, and ME courses, excluding technical electives. The courses necessary to earn this degree are listed below. Students should be aware that many courses have prerequisites and/or corequisites. Students must have a C or better in all prerequisites for all required AE, EGR, EP, ES, COM 221, ME, and SYS courses. chunk_text: a minimum of 36 hours of General Education coursework. For a full description of Embry-Riddle General Education guidelines, please see the General Education section of this catalog.
